alert.note: Alert for Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 10:34AM EDT until July 14 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Walton County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 1245 PM CDT. * At 934 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Rosa Beach, Grayton Beach, Seaside, Blue Mountain Beach, Seagrove Beach, Port Washington, Bunker, Inlet Beach, Four Mile Village, Sandestin, Gulf Pines and Miramar Beach. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
